original: dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yid rang ste /
analyzed: dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yid rang ste /
translated: and the world with its gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas rejoiced.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
translated: They praised what the Blessed One had said.

original: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las /
translated: This was the chapter of Rāṣṭrapāla, the eighteenth of the Dharma Discourses of the Great Heap of Jewels.

original: yul 'khor skyong gis zhus pa'i le'u zhes bya ste; 'dus pa bco brgyad pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: yul 'khor skyong gis zhus pa'i le'u zhes bya ste; 'dus pa bco brgyad pa rdzogs so ////

original: rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / d'a na sh'i la dang / mu ni warma dang / zhu chen gyi lotstsha ba bandhe ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te /
analyzed: rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / d'a na sh'i la dang / mu ni warma dang / zhu chen gyi lotstsha ba bandhe ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te /
translated: The Indian preceptors Jinamitra, Dānaśīla, and Munivarman, and the chief editor-in-chief, the Venerable Yeshé Dé, translated and revised this text.

original: skad gsar bcad kyis kyang bcos nas gtan la phab pa ///
analyzed: skad gsar bcad kyis kyang bcos nas gtan la phab pa ///
translated: It was finalized as the definitive version.
